history.content:
If you do 61A P/NP and intend to take it for a letter grade later, you have to NP it.

In terms of how it'll affect your petition for the major. As long as you NP (won't count towards your GPA) and take it for a letter grade and make the 3.3 GPA cut you should be fine.

Keep in mind a NP doesn't look too good if you plan on any sort of grad school.

Best of luck with your decision!

Hey student, 

Unfortunately, Lily and Christopher are both out of town, but Charlene (L&S CS Adviser) is around tomorrow in 203 Cory Hall. Additionally I'm happy to chat with you about this.

My main concern with your plan is the idea of taking both courses this summer. I would highly highly discourage you from taking them concurrently as (1) they're tough (2) 61A is a pre-req for 61B and most importantly (3) these courses are happening in fast forward. 

Please keep in mind that only Fall 2015 admits are subject to the 3.30 requirement. If you're a freshman there's even less reason to take these courses together this summer, you still have plenty of time to declare.

children.subject: The student's answer is correct. Unfortunately, you must receive a NP or letter grade of D+ or lower to repeat the course. For reference: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/academic-records/grades

I'm a little confused. I emailed cs advising and they said that the major admission committee only looks unfavorably on those who are on the verge of making the GPA cap and try to retake a course in order to make it. Additionally, in the page linked above, under "Repeating a Course" it reads:

Repeating a Course With a Passing Grade

If you repeat a course in which you received a passing grade (other than a D, F, NP, or U), the course will count as part of your course schedule for the semester and the grade you earn will be listed on your transcript. However, the grade will not be included in your GPA, and the course units will not count toward graduation unless the course description in the Berkeley Academic Guide states "course may be repeated for credit."

history.content:
Hi. I'm in a pretty big dilemma.

I took 61A this semester with the ultimate goal of petitioning for the CS major. However, due to pretty unavoidable issues back at home, I've had to continuously travel back and forth and it's just been a stressful semester and I haven't done nearly as well as I had hoped I would do, so I changed to P/NP. I had signed up to take 61BL over summer, and I thought I should also take 61A over summer along with 61BL for a grade. Does anybody know if I will run into administrative problems by doing this? I know that the department says that it is highly discouraged to retake for higher grades, but what happens to people who take 61A P/NP to try it and then decide that they want to petition?


Any response/advice is greatly appreciated.
history.subject: Declaring CS
